name: squally
content:
squally adjective
(WEATHER)
Add to word list
Add to word list
with sudden strong winds or short storms: There is some squally weather on its way. A sudden squally shower threatened to blow my umbrella inside out.
More examplesFewer examplesThe weather was still squally with a cold wind.Steve kept referring to the build-up of dark threatening clouds and the forecast of squally showers. Foul weather with squally winds delayed the start of the building work.

squally adjective
(NOISY)
screaming or crying loudly, or making noises that sound like this: The woman was criticized for bringing a particularly squally baby to church. Her singing sometimes sounded painfully squally.
More examplesFewer examplesHow am I supposed to tell three squally grandchildren that there's no toast for breakfast?He growled the lyrics over squally guitar.The soprano was steady in tone but often squally and uncertain of pitch in the formidable florid passages.
